Author: ovi256
Content: I will eat anybody's words once anybody mankes Strong OR Weak AI.

Author: davidw
Content:
With an altitude? There are a lot of good ones outside of places like Colorado:-)

Joking aside, I am going to respectfully say that I'm not sure you have fully digested the meaning of 'hacker' as we use it here. This comes fairly close:

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hacker_(Free_and_Open_Source_Software)

(watch out for the mangled parens), although of course many people aren't working on open source projects. An 'attitude' isn't really part of the picture, IMO, as some of the best hackers I've met are also extremely nice (and well adjusted) individuals. When you're that good, you don't need an attitude to communicate how good you are.

To keep using PG as a useful specimen for examination, the reason I think he's more hacker than entrepreneur is that an "entrepreneur" (in my mind) is less likely to go out and build something that is (once again in my mind) completely useless in terms of making money, like, say, Arc. It's just a fun thing to build that scratches his itch.

Author: ra
Content:
Sweet.

Thanks for Searchyc - it's great; very tidy. I hope it leads you on to greater things.

Author: vineet21
Title: Online Advertising To Grow Rapidly At The Expense Of Print Advertising
Content: "Marketers are continuing to put their ad dollars online at the expense of print advertising. Some 55% of marketers anticipate a decrease in print ad spend three years from now."

Author: bigbang
Content: I believe paypal doesnt require customers to have a paypal account. Just entering the credit card should be fine (i.e without registration). But my usage with paypal is just as a customer though

Author: chengmi
Content: It wasn't the transfer quota. Our web host decided to randomly shut down the virtual server that day--while I was out of town.

Author: gaika
Content: Erlang is terrible for distributed computations, it is even slower than ruby for math :( Network servers is probably the only thing that is worth doing in erlang.

Author: michael_dorfman
Content: The video is quite cool, but I'd be much more impressed by a link to a paper describing the algorithm in detail.  Does anyone know if/where this work has been published?
